issue.title: dorawatch.net
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://dorawatch.net](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdorawatch.net) ### Comment > im trying to watch movies and shows but the adblock dosent block the popups. i probably got a virus as my computer is very slow now. ``` Username: @THELASTSIGMAOFALLALPHAS69420 ``` ### Screenshots

AdGuard Base

issue.title: walmart.com

comment.body: It turns out this pattern is common. `https://www.clearscore.com/Idw5w468/init.js` is the fingerprinting script hosted on `clearscore.com` and `https://www.clearscore.com/~partytown/partytown-sandbox-sw.html?1757727150961` works in a similar way. This pattern also allows file loading from third party. For example, in `https://www.stylecraze.com/`, it has `<script type="text/partytown" src="https://stylecraze-proxy.ad-network-admin.workers.dev/reverse-proxy/connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js" data-ptsrc="https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js"</script>`. In `https://www.thebridalbox.com/`, it has `<script type="text/partytown" src="https://thebribalbox-px.ad-network-admin.workers.dev/reverse-proxy/connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js" data-ptsrc="https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js" </script>` but `fbevents.js` is blocked in this case.
